summary: The document is a memorandum from J. Barry Harrelson, DCI/CSI/HRG, JFK Project Officer, to Fred Wickham, DO Focal Point for JFK Board, concerning the ARRB's request for more information and records about the JFK assassination. It details the Mexico City Station's operations, including surveillance and investigations related to Lee Harvey Oswald's activities in Mexico City prior to the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
key_findings: The Mexico City Station engaged in a broad spectrum of operations targeting Soviet, Cuban, Satellite, and Communist Party activities.
Investigations into Lee Harvey Oswald's contacts with the Soviet and Cuban Embassies in Mexico City were conducted following the JFK assassination.
Surveillance methods employed by the station included audio installations in Cuban facilities, many of which were unsuccessful.
An extensive review in July 1964 of the Mexico City Station's administrative and operational programs underscored its wide-ranging operational capacities.
